result.execSummary:
The defendant Rendell G Giles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary (Home Invasion) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary (Home Invasion) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Burglary (Home Invasion) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: AS TO COUNTS ONE, TWO AND THREE:  Concurrent to each other. Credit given for five (5) days.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision on counts, two and three are same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: In the amounts of:  $20.00 to victim Brittney H. ; $40.00 to victim Victor B.;  $50.00 to victim Gavin L.; $100.00 to victim Colin L.  ALL RESTITUTION, EACH AMOUNT is joint and several with coactors Andre Dallas 14CF768 and Michael Scott Jr. 14CF770.

EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS  ORDERED:  to be paid over period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, unless already done, and pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
NO CONTACT WITH:  the victims, UW-Milwaukee, the coactors Andre Dallas and Michael Scott Jr.
Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.   Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.
*Conditions apply to all counts/case.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for employment, school and AODA treatment purposes only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rendell G Giles

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Request For Good Time received, signed, and filed with court.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. crt
Letter Filed by Defendant Rendell Giles.

Petition and Order for Funeral Pass - GRANTED; signed and filed.  
Faxed to HOC/JAIL. tk

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Peter D. Ploetz.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Sentencing proceeds. No corrections made to PSI report. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's father, Raymond G.

Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS, concurrent to each other.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. 
Credit given for 5 days time served if revoked.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS under the supervision of the Wisconsin of Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 12 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Corrections with release privileges for employment, school, and AODA treatment purposes only.
* No contact with the victims.
* No contact with UW- Milwaukee.
* No contact with the co-actors, Andre Dallas and Michael Scott, Jr.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless already done) and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $20.00 to the victim, Brittney H., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770).  To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $40.00 to the victim, Victor B., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770).  To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $50.00 to the victim, Gavin L., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770).  To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $100.00 to the victim, Colin L., joint and several, with co-actors Andre Dallas (14CF768) AND Michael Scott, Jr. (14CF770).  To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

FILED, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
(11) Defendant's Character Witness Letters; filed.

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Peter D. Ploetz.  Sarah McNutt for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with sentencing today.
Parties wish to adjourn this matter along with co-defendant, Michael Scott's, case.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 09-26-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
ADDENDUM to PSI filed 08-01-2014; filed.
for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #4 and Count #5 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

**Court ordered a Presentence Investigation Report with a sentencing recommendation.

Case adjourned to 08-07-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea and Sentencing in Branch 2. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Peter D Ploetz.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Joint request for a status date allowing time to review offer with the defendant is approved.  Case is adjourned for status in Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for 05-20-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Parties request a status conference date; ADA Ringersma is reviewing this case.

Case adjourned to 04-17-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.
Filed.

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Peter D. Ploetz.  Timothy Cotter for Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
$1000.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).  Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-actors Andre Dallas and Michael Scott. Sandburg Residence Hall and UWM Campus.

Defendant Rendell G Giles in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Janet Claire Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/14 @ 1:30pm
